intro: Poacynum venetum, commonly known as the Venetian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Poacynum venetum is typically found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
